string_table.string: Use the w, a, s, and d keys to move around the 360 degree image. Press the tab key to jump to interactive markers and hotspots.
To watch this video, use the preview feature in Storyline 360, upload your published output to a server, publish to Review 360, or switch to static video quality.
Streaming video is unavailable for local playback.

slidelink.displaytext: Module 3: Tailoring Support to Individual Needs
Module 4: Navigating healthcare websites and portals
Module 5: Promoting online safety and privacy

search.slidetext: digital health champions training course get started get started get started get started get started get started bridging the digital divide for elderly health management

introduction and objectives welcome to the digital health champions training program! objectives: 1- understand the digital divide and its impact. 2- learn effective communication strategies. 3- gain practical skills for online health management support.

training agenda module 1: understanding the digital divide module 2: engaging and communicating effectively module 3: overcoming support challenges module 4: practical online health management support module 5: empowering independence in digital health module 6: assessment and evaluation

missing out on remote healthcare services struggles with online booking systems difficulty finding reliable online health resources. module 1: impact on health management limited access to information appointment scheduling challenges telehealth access issues

acknowledge and reassure their fears. customize assistance based on individual needs. learning new technologies takes time. module 1: building empathy and understanding patience tailored support validate concerns
module 2 engaging and communicating with elderly relatives and friends
module 2: engaging and communicating effectively spending quality time together. showing genuine interest. being reliable and dependable.

summarize or paraphrase to ensure understanding acknowledge emotions without judgment minimize distractions and focus on the conversation. module 2: active listening and empathy undivided attention validate feelings reflective listening

seek help from bilingual family members or friends. utilize apps or services for accurate communication. use pictures, diagrams, and gestures. module 2: language and terminology considerations visual aids translation tools bilingual assistance
module 3 overcoming challenges in supporting digital health management

build confidence with positive reinforcement. involve them in decision-making to promote ownership identify if they learn best through hands-on practice, visual aids, or instructions module 3: tailoring support to individual needs preferred learning methods respecting autonomy reassurance and encouragement
module 4 providing practical support for health management online
create shortcuts for easy access guide through accessing and using key website features. module 4: navigating healthcare websites and portals step-by-step demonstrations bookmarking important links

early detection of issues, improved medication adherence, better communication with healthcare providers introduce apps for monitoring vital signs, medication schedules, and symptoms. module 4: encouraging self-monitoring and tracking health tracking apps benefits
module 5 empowering elderly individuals in digital health management

safeguarding health information through privacy settings and data protection tips on creating strong passwords, recognizing phishing attempts, and using secure platforms module 5: promoting online safety and privacy cybersecurity education protecting personal information

safeguarding health information through privacy settings and data protection tips on creating strong passwords, recognizing phishing attempts, and using secure platforms module 5: celebrating successes and milestones recognise progress positive reinforcement

go to the assessment go to the assessment go to the assessment go to the assessment go to the assessment go to the assessment review the course review the course review the course review the course review the course review the course
module 6 assessment and evaluation

(select all that apply) use complex language to demonstrate expertise. use complex language to demonstrate expertise. use complex language to demonstrate expertise. use complex language to demonstrate expertise. use complex language to demonstrate expertise. use complex language to demonstrate expertise. break tasks into manageable steps. break tasks into manageable steps. break tasks into manageable steps. break tasks into manageable steps. break tasks into manageable steps. break tasks into manageable steps. be patient and understanding during the learning process. be patient and understanding during the learning process. be patient and understanding during the learning process. be patient and understanding during the learning process. be patient and understanding during the learning process. be patient and understanding during the learning process. encourage fear of technology to avoid mistakes. encourage fear of technology to avoid mistakes. encourage fear of technology to avoid mistakes. encourage fear of technology to avoid mistakes. encourage fear of technology to avoid mistakes. encourage fear of technology to avoid mistakes. tailor support to individual needs and preferences. tailor support to individual needs and preferences. tailor support to individual needs and preferences. tailor support to individual needs and preferences. tailor support to individual needs and preferences. tailor support to individual needs and preferences.

incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue type your text here the _____________ refers to the gap between those who have access to and can effectively use digital technologies and those who cannot.

incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue match the following terms with their correct definitions by selecting the appropriate option from the dropdown menus. digital divide the gap between those who have access to digital technologies and those who do not. telehealth the practice of providing healthcare services remotely using digital tools. active listening fully focusing, understanding, and responding to what someone is saying.

incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue arrange the steps in the correct order for helping an elderly individual schedule a healthcare appointment online by dragging and dropping the options into the correct sequence. select the healthcare provider's website or portal. navigate to the appointment scheduling section. choose a preferred date and time for the appointment. confirm the appointment details. set a reminder for the appointment.
